{"step_by_step_thinking": "The perinatal mortality rate is a measure of the number of stillbirths and early neonatal deaths per 1,000 total births. It includes both stillbirths and deaths that occur within the first week of life. Therefore, the denominator in the perinatal mortality rate should include both live births and stillbirths. The correct choice is C. Live births + Stillbirths.", "answer_choice": "C"}
